report_title: Big Hat Group Weekly Security Update Report
report_description: The Weekly Security Update Report is provided by Big Hat Group with the goal of making it easier to find the information System Administrators and Security Professionals need to keep their systems secure. The CVE Weekly Report is provided as a beta resource.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36907 Windows Cryptographic Services Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cryptographic Services is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2023-36907) with a base score of 5.5 and a temporal score of 4.8. The vulnerability allows a locally authenticated attacker to read small portions of heap memory by sending a specially crafted request to the cryptography provider's vulnerable function. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and privileges required, and no user interaction. The impact is high on confidentiality, but there is no impact on integrity and availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36906 Windows Cryptographic Services Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Cryptographic Services is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, CVE-2023-36906, with a base score of 5.5 and a temporal score of 4.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to read small portions of heap memory by sending a specially crafted request to the cryptography provider's vulnerable function. The attack vector is local, with low attack complexity and privileges required, and no user interaction. The impact is high on confidentiality but does not affect integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36698 Windows Kernel Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kernel is affected by a security feature bypass vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36698, with a CVSS base score of 4.4 and a temporal score of 3.9. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the Windows Arbitrary Code Guard (ACG) exploit protection feature, potentially leading to limited compromises in system integrity and availability. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and privileges required, and does not involve user interaction. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server, to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that exploitation is less likely, and no exploit code is currently available. The official fix is available, and no specific workaround or mitigation beyond applying the security updates is mentioned. For more information, system administrators can refer to the Microsoft Security Support Lifecycle and the Common Vulnerability Scoring System documentation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36596 Remote Procedure Call Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The CVE-2023-36596 vulnerability affects various Microsoft products, leading to information disclosure with a maximum severity of 'Important'. It has a CVSS base score of 7.5 and a temporal score of 6.5. The vulnerability is related to Remote Procedure Call and can be exploited remotely without user interaction, potentially allowing an attacker to read small portions of heap memory. The attack complexity is low, and no privileges or user interaction are required. Microsoft has provided security updates for a wide range of affected products, including different versions of Windows Server, Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is marked as 'Official Fix', indicating the availability of a complete vendor solution. This informational update includes revised CVSS scores for the affected products, signifying the importance of promptly applying the provided security updates to address the vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-5996 Use after free in WebAudio
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in WebAudio, identified as CVE-2023-5996. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build numbers 119.0.2151.58 and 118.0.2088.102 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the mentioned build numbers. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest versions to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.
section_1_data.products: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based), Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Extended Stable
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows for a use after free condition in WebAudio.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is to update to the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). The versions that are no longer vulnerable are 119.0.2151.58 (Stable) and 118.0.2088.102 (Extended Stable).

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36024 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by an Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36024, with a CVSS score of 7.1. The vulnerability requires user interaction to open a specially crafted file, which could lead to a browser sandbox escape and potential remote code execution. Successful exploitation could result in minor loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The severity is rated as Moderate due to the level of user interaction required, although the CVSS score is higher. Microsoft has released security updates for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) versions 118.0.2088.102 and 119.0.2151.58 to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the official fix to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.
section_1_data.symptoms: Unsafe default configurations for LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing exist on Active Directory domain controllers that let LDAP clients communicate with them without enforcing LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing. This can open Active Directory domain controllers to an elevation of privilege vulnerability.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36014 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36014, with a CVSS score of 7.3/6.4. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. It is caused by a flaw in Microsoft Edge's Chromium-based engine. Successful exploitation could result in a total loss of confidentiality and integrity, as well as reduced availability. The attack vector is local, requiring user interaction, and the attack complexity is low, with no privileges required. Microsoft has released a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) versions 119.0.2151.58 and 118.0.2088.102 to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page for CVE-2023-36014.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability is triggered when a user views a specially crafted webpage using Microsoft Edge. This allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability involves modifying the way Microsoft Edge handles objects in memory. The update corrects the vulnerability by changing how Microsoft Edge handles objects in memory.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36027 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by an Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36027, with a CVSS score of 7.1. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain remote code execution privileges by running a specially crafted application or convincing a local user to open a malicious file. Successful exploitation could lead to minor loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The severity is rated as Important, and Microsoft has provided a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build numbers 118.0.2088.102 and 119.0.2151.58. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attacker would need to combine this vulnerability with other vulnerabilities to perform an attack. No workaround or temporary fix is mentioned. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page.
section_1_data.symptoms: Unsafe default configurations for LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing exist on Active Directory domain controllers that let LDAP clients communicate with them without enforcing LDAP channel binding and LDAP signing. This can open Active Directory domain controllers to an elevation of privilege vulnerability.
section_1_data.fixes: Microsoft has released an official fix to address this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) to the latest version to mitigate this vulnerability.
